Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the shoulder and neck section of a brown pottery amphora with ribbed body and one handle surviving, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and bears very faint traces of a Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394432) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394432)
